edu.rit.pj2

Class Section

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pj2.Section
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public abstract class Section
extends Object
implements Cloneable
    Class Section is the abstract base class for a section of code executed in parallel with other sections.

    Programming pattern. To execute a group of different parallel sections in the main() method of a Task, follow this pattern: 

     public class MyTask extends Task
     {
     public void main (String[] args)
         {
         parallelDo (new Section()
             {
             public void run()
                 {
                 // Code for first section
                 }
             },
         new Section()
             {
             public void run()
                 {
                 // Code for second section
                 }
             });
         }
     }

    There can be any number of sections in the parallelDo() method call. There must be at least one section.

    To execute a number of copies of the same parallel section in the main() method of a Task, follow this pattern: 

     public class MyTask extends Task
     {
     public void main (String[] args)
         {
         parallelDo (3, new Section()
             {
             public void run()
                 {
                 // Code for section
                 }
             });
         }
     }

    In the above example, three copies of the section are executed in parallel.

    Parallel thread team. The parallel section group is executed by a team of threads. There are as many threads as there are sections. Each thread calls the run() method on a different Section object.

    End-of-sections barrier. There is an implicit barrier at the end of the parallel section group. After returning from the run() method, each team thread arrives at the barrier. Once every team thread has arrived at the barrier, the parallelDo() method returns.

    Reduction. To execute a parallel section group with reduction, follow this pattern: 

     public class MyTask extends Task
     {
     IntVbl counter = new IntVbl.Sum();

     public void main (String[] args)
         {
         parallelDo (new Section()
             {
             public void run()
                 {
                 IntVbl thrCounter = threadLocal (counter);
                 thrCounter.item = 42; // or whatever
                 }
             },
         new Section()
             {
             public void run()
                 {
                 IntVbl thrCounter = threadLocal (counter);
                 thrCounter.item = 24; // or whatever
                 }
             });
         System.out.printf ("Counter = %d%n", counter.item);
         }
     }

    In this example, counter is declared as a field of the Task subclass, and so is a global shared variable. It is an instance of class IntVbl.Sum. The counter's item field is an integer. The counter's reduce() method adds the item fields together.

    Each thread, upon calling its section's run() method, calls the threadLocal() method, passing in the global counter. This returns a thread-local copy of the global counter, which becomes the thread's own thrCounter. Each thread sets its own thrCounter's item to a certain value. Note that no synchronization is required, as each thread is updating its own thrCounter.

    When the parallel section group finishes executing, all the threads' local variables are automatically reduced together in a multiple thread safe fashion. The reduction is performed by the reduce() method, so all the threads' local counters' item fields are added together. The result (66 in this example) is stored back in the global variable's item field, which is then printed.

    See Also:
    ParallelStatement

      • Section

        public Section()

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public abstract void run()
                  throws Exception
        Execute this section.
        Throws:
        Exception - The run() method may throw any exception.

      • parallelFor

        public IntParallelForLoop parallelFor(int lb,
                             int ub)
        Execute a work sharing parallel for loop with a loop index of type int. The loop index goes from the given lower bound to the given upper bound. For further information, see classes ParallelForLoop and IntParallelForLoop.

        The parallelFor() method lets a parallel for loop be nested inside a parallel section. The parallelFor() method may only be called from the section's run() method.

        Parameters:
        lb - Loop index lower bound (inclusive).
        ub - Loop index upper bound (inclusive).
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the parallelFor() method is not called from the run() method.

      • parallelFor

        public LongParallelForLoop parallelFor(long lb,
                              long ub)
        Execute a work sharing parallel for loop with a loop index of type long. The loop index goes from the given lower bound to the given upper bound. For further information, see classes ParallelForLoop and LongParallelForLoop.

        The parallelFor() method lets a parallel for loop be nested inside a parallel section. The parallelFor() method may only be called from the section's run() method.

        Parameters:
        lb - Loop index lower bound (inclusive).
        ub - Loop index upper bound (inclusive).
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the parallelFor() method is not called from the run() method.

      • parallelFor

        public <E> IteratorParallelForLoop<E> parallelFor(Iterator<E> iter)
        Execute a work sharing parallel for loop over the elements returned by an Iterator. The iterator must return only non-null elements. For further information, see classes ParallelForLoop and IteratorParallelForLoop.

        The parallelFor() method lets a parallel for loop be nested inside a parallel section. The parallelFor() method may only be called from the section's run() method.

        Type Parameters:
        E - Data type of the elements returned by the iterator.
        Parameters:
        iter - Iterator.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the parallelFor() method is not called from the run() method.
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if iter is null.

      • parallelFor

        public <E> IteratorParallelForLoop<E> parallelFor(Iterable<E> coll)
        Execute a work sharing parallel for loop over the elements of an Iterable collection. The collection must contain only non-null elements. For further information, see classes ParallelForLoop and IteratorParallelForLoop.

        The parallelFor() method lets a parallel for loop be nested inside a parallel section. The parallelFor() method may only be called from the section's run() method.

        Type Parameters:
        E - Data type of the elements in the collection.
        Parameters:
        coll - Iterable collection.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the parallelFor() method is not called from the run() method.
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if coll is null.

      • threadLocal

        public <V extends Vbl> V threadLocal(V global)
        Get a thread-local copy of the given global shared variable. The global variable and the local variable are instances of a subclass of class Vbl. The section can update the local variable without needing to synchronize with other threads. When the parallel section group finishes execution, all the local copies are automatically reduced together using the Vbl subclass's reduce() method, and the result is stored into the global variable (overwriting whatever was there).

        The threadLocal() method may only be called from the run() method.

        Parameters:
        global - Global shared variable.
        Returns:
        Thread-local copy of global. Typically, it is cast to the data type of global.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the threadLocal() method is not called from the run() method.

      • threads

        public int threads()
        Returns the number of threads in the thread team executing this parallel section group.

        The threads() method may only be called from the run() method.

        Returns:
        Number of threads.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the threads() method is not called from the run() method.

      • rank

        public int rank()
        Returns the rank of the thread executing this section.

        The rank() method may only be called from the run() method.

        Returns:
        Rank in the range 0 .. threads()−1.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the rank() method is not called from the run() method.

      • clone

        public Object clone()
        Create a clone of this section object.

        Returns:
        The cloned object.
